name: ITP - Excavation and Support - 5.0 Construction (Bench)
template name: ITP - Excavation and Support - 5.0 Construction (Bench) Rev 2

name: Description - PTT shall define the planned excavation limits and support types (RESS) prior to each defined period of excavation in each heading or bench face.
○ Tunnel excavation shall not commence on a shift until PTT has been signed off
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specifications C0650, Tunnel Sequential Excavation Section 5.1
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Description - Recommend the required support type based on the Actual Ground Conditions.
○ Determine any corrective measures required to ensure safety and stability of the excavation.
○ Identify if the ground conditions depart from the expected range of conditions for which a support type has been designed and notify the Designer if new design is required.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specifications C0650, Tunnel Sequential Excavation Section 5.1
Test frequency - Every advance or as agreed in DRM
Verifying Records - Required Excavation and support sheet
Description - Control the E-Line before, during and after excavation is finished
Method/Description - Surveyor to set out and record as built. VMT system to provide e-line guidance
Description - delivery dockets check, slump and temperature check
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 5.4, NZS 3109: 1997
○ Delivery dockets to include the following; Batch number,

○ Batch temperature at time of dispatch and delivery, Mix designation, Date and time of mixing, Quantity delivered, The delivery truck number, Date and time the delivery truck left the batching plant, Amounts of water, ad mixture, or any other ingredients made after despatch, and time at which such additions are made, Steel fibre type and content, Micro fibre type and content, and, any other relevant information.
Description - batching, mixing and transport to comply with NZS3104
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 5.3, NZS 3104
Description - Prepare all surfaces to be shotcreted prior to application of shotcrete
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0650 - Tunnel Civil Works Section 5.4
Conformance Criteria - Surface clean and free of loose material, pre-wet surface immediately prior to spraying.
○ Any residual flowing or seeping water shall be controlled using channels, chases, pipes, or other approved means.
○ Spalled, cracked, loose or contaminated shotcrete removed.
Verifying Records - refer to checksheet in 5.2.9
Description - Provide control means to verify the thickness of final shotcrete layer
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 8131 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8119
Description - Provide control means to verify the intrados clearance of the shotcrete lining
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 3131 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8120
Description - Provide control means to verify the C-line clearance of the shotcrete lining
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.7
Test frequency - As-builts shall be taken of EACH layer of shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Shotcrete thickness shall be sprayed in accordance with drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8129, 8130, and 3831 and within the tolerances outlined in drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8121

Description - Underside of top heading lining at connection with bench lining to be cleaned by pressure air jet and water and inspected by the designer's representative prior to placement of bench shotcrete.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 3.2 Table 3.1
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Verifying Records - refer to checksheet in 5.2.8
Description - The footing invert (top heading and bench) shall be clean and clear of all debris and shotcrete rebound and inspected by designer's representative prior to placement of shotcrete.
Test frequency - Prior to each Spray
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Description - Curing to be carried out in accordance with the Specification
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0651 - Tunnel Shotcrete Clause 5.5
Verifying Records - refer to checksheet in 5.2.8
Description - To comply with the waviness criteria outlined in Drawing MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8119
Conformance Criteria - maximum deptth of depressions between peaks: 50mm
○ Maximum gradient between peak and trough of irregularities: 1:20
Verifying Records - Refer to asbuilt in 5.2.5
Description - To prove position, cover and overlap are achieved
Conformance Criteria - Longitudinal and transverse overlap of 250mm ( one mesh square plus 50mm)
○ Min. cover 65mm at the extrados and 85mm at the intrados
Verifying Records - Mesh Check Sheet, As-built
Description - Bolts shall be drilled to the depth, diameter, alignment and position specified on the Drawings or instructed by the Designer.
○ To ensure correct installation process for resin injection
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement, section 5.2, 5.3
Conformance Criteria - bolts shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.

— The Constructor shall record a drilling log for each drillhole, including the date and time of installation and any difficulties or problems that were encountered. Dowels to be clean or any other physical damage at the time of installation
— Type of bolts, diameter, length, location, spacing and orientation according to detailed design

— Sufficient volume of resin to be used with each rock reinforcement installation in accordance with The approved project specific procedure developed during The trials. Daily records of all grouting works to be kept
— Bolts free of dirt, detrimental rust or any other deleterious substances
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt Installation Record
Description - Bolts to be installed in the position specified on the drawings or as instructed by the designer
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement section 5.3
Conformance Criteria - bolts shall be installed perpendicular to the excavation face unless stated otherwise.
○ Where rockbolts are not able to be installed perpendicular, the maximum deviation shall be 18 degrees from perpendicular.
Verifying Records - Rock Bolt As built Survey
Description - Demonstrate that the installed rock reinforcements can provide at least the design working load capacity.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0652 - Tunnel Rock Reinforcement Clause 6.5

Test frequency - 1. The first nine installations of each type of rock bolt and the first nine installations of each type of rock dowel shall be tested in each ground type as it presents in production. At least one test location of each type shall be in the tunnel crown unless otherwise directed by the Designer’s Representative.
○ 2. 5% of the next 100 installations of rock bolts and rock dowels, proportionately throughout the ground types presenting.

Conformance Criteria - The bolt or dowel is deemed acceptable if, during the cycle, the displacement of the bolt or dowel head relative to the measuring datum (after allowing for any temperature changes) does not exceed the criteria for 100% of the working load, as set out in Table 6.4 of the specification.
○ Failure criteria: 2% Maximum Permissible Displacement or failure to maintain specified loads or ongoing creep of the rock bolt or rock dowel
Description - Record location and ensure correct installation of materials
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Section 5
Conformance Criteria - Location and quantity of the strip drains shall be as instructed on site by the Designer's representative
○ Position checked to ensure shotcrete adequate cover
○ Materials are free of damage before spraying strip drain and fittings adequately secured to the shotcrete
○ Drainage holes installed as per instructions
○ End of strip drains and hose protected
Verifying Records - Refer to as-built in 5.5.2
Description - As-built of strip drain location
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Section 5
Conformance Criteria - Location sinstalled as per instructed on site by the Designer's representative as-built checked to ensure adequate cover
Description - surveyor to confirm vertical position prior to encasement in shotcrete. Flushing tube connection point with proprietary fitting and cap
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Description - underside of top heading lining at connection with bench lining to be cleaned by pressure air jet and water, and inspected by the designers rep prior to placement of the bench shotcrete
Conformance Criteria - Hold point released by CPS
Verifying Records - Refer to as-built in 5.5.2
Description - Record location and ensure correct installation of materials
Conformance Criteria - 4.5m long 76mm diameter holes drilled at 4m centres along the sides of the tunnel (location dependant on strip drains and rockbolt locations)
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
ITP - Excavation and Support - 6.0 Tunnel Defects
template name: ITP - Excavation and Support - 6.0 Tunnel Defects Rev 2

name: Description - an approved methodology and materials for defect repair
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.6
Conformance Criteria - Approved methodology and materials
Description - The final layer of shotcrete shall be inspected for any defects and repaired accordingly.
○ At the completion of the lining,
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0650 - Tunnel Sequential Excavation, section 5.6
Test frequency - Every defect on Every advance
Conformance Criteria - Cracks > 0.5mm to be repaired
○ All core holes in the lining (resulting from testing or inspection) shall be backfilled with non-shrink mortar of an equivalent strength and fire resistance properties unless otherwise specified.
○ The surface of the restored hole shall be similar to the surrounding surface in texture and colour.

Description - Where the inflow into the tunnel exceeds the design criteria,appropriate post-installed drainage measures shall be proposed by the Constructor and approved by the Designer’s representative.
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification - C0653 - Tunnel Groundwater Control Systems Clause 6
Conformance Criteria - Shall not be exceed 3L/m of length/day averaged over a 100m length of tunnel. Where exceeded, the post-installation groundwater methodology is to be followed.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.

template name: ITP - Excavation and Support - 7.0 Monitoring Rev 2

name: Description - Monitoring and reading records of the tunnel extensometer
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0660 - Tunnel Convergence Monitoring

Test frequency - from excavation face
>100m = Monthly
40m-100m = Weekly
15m - 40m = 2x weekly
<15m = daily
Conformance Criteria - outlined in MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8180 Table 3
Description - Monitoring and reading records on the tunnel optical survey targets
Specifications and Standards - Technical Specification C0660 - Tunnel Convergence Monitoring

Test frequency - from excavation face
>100m = Monthly
40m-100m = Weekly
15m - 40m = 2x weekly
<15m = daily
Conformance Criteria - outlined in MMA-DES-TUN-E1-DRG-8180 Table 3
